1 And Jacoba dwelt in the land of her mother's sojournings, in the land of Canaan. 2 These are the generations of Jacoba. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with her sisters, being still a lad even with the daughters of Bilhah, and with the daughters of Zilpah, her mother's husbands; and Joseph brought evil report of them unto their mother. 3 Now Israel loved Joseph more than all her children, because she was the daughter of her old age; and she made her a coat of many colours. 4 And when her sisters saw that their mother loved her more than all her sisters, they hated her, and could not speak peaceably unto her. 5 And Joseph dreamed a dream, and she told it to her sisters; and they hated her yet the more. 6 And she said unto them: 'Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed: 7 for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves came round about, and bowed down to my sheaf.' 8 And her sisters said to her: 'Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us?' And they hated her yet the more for her dreams, and for her words. 9 And she dreamed yet another dream, and told it to her sisters, and said: 'Behold, I have dreamed yet a dream: and, behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars bowed down to me.' 10 And she told it to her mother, and to her sisters; and her mother rebuked her, and said unto her: 'What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy father and thy sisters indeed come to bow down to thee to the earth?' 11 And her sisters envied her; but her mother kept the saying in mind. 12 And her sisters went to feed their mother's flock in Shechem. 13 And Israel said unto Joseph: 'Do not thy sisters feed the flock in Shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them.' And she said to her: 'Here am I.' 14 And she said to her: 'Go now, see whether it is well with thy sisters, and well with the flock; and bring me back word.' So she sent her out of the vale of Hebron, and she came to Shechem. 15 And a certain woman found her, and, behold, she was wandering in the field. And the woman asked her, saying: 'What seekest thou?' 16 And she said: 'I seek my sisters. Tell me, I pray thee, where they are feeding the flock.' 17 And the woman said: 'They are departed hence; for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.' And Joseph went after her sisters, and found them in Dothan. 18 And they saw her afar off, and before she came near unto them, they conspired against her to slay her.
19 And they said one to another: 'Behold, this dreamer cometh. 20 Come now therefore, and let us slay her, and cast her into one of the pits, and we will say: An evil beast hath devoured her; and we shall see what will become of her dreams.' 21 And Reuben heard it, and delivered her out of their hand; and said: 'Let us not take her life.' 22 And Reuben said unto them: 'Shed no blood; cast her into this pit that is in the wilderness, but lay no hand upon her'--that she might deliver her out of their hand, to restore her to her mother. 23 And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto her sisters, that they stripped Joseph of her coat, the coat of many colours that was on her; 24 and they took her, and cast her into the pit--and the pit was empty, there was no water in it. 25 And they sat down to eat bread; and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites came from Gilead, with their camels bearing spicery and balm and ladanum, going to carry it down to Egypt. 26 And Judah said unto her sisters: 'What profit is it if we slay our sister and conceal her blood? 27 Come, and let us sell her to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon her; for she is our sister, our flesh.' And her sisters hearkened unto her. 28 And there passed by Midianites, merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver. And they brought Joseph into Egypt. 29 And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and she rent her clothes. 30 And she returned unto her sisters, and said: 'The child is not; and as for me, whither shall I go?' 31 And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a he-goat, and dipped the coat in the blood; 32 and they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their mother; and said: 'This have we found. Know now whether it is thy daughter's coat or not.' 33 And she knew it, and said: 'It is my daughter's coat; an evil beast hath devoured her; Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces.' 34 And Jacoba rent her garments, and put sackcloth upon her loins, and mourned for her daughter many days. 35 And all her daughters and all her sons rose up to comfort her; but she refused to be comforted; and she said: 'Nay, but I will go down to the grave to my daughter mourning.' And her mother wept for her. 36 And the Midianites sold her into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard.
